website_summaries.verdict: The best way to have a large amount of storage for a desktop without breaking the bank.
pros: The design of the hard drive is narrow enough to fit on most desktop work spaces
Will work automatically with PC and Mac computers
cons: Hard drive requires an included power supply and cannot be powered from USB alone

customer_reviews.title: Junk drive, save you money
customer_reviews.text: This drive is junk. It is slow, and it failed after less then 4 months of VERY occasional use. No longer powers up. There's no switch -- it is supposed to activate with power and when the USB3 is plugged in. Nothing. The housing is tinny. The power supply cable is very thin/cheap/fragile, and the connectors are sloppy. Has no value as a backup drive if it doesn't work.... I don't break stuff -- I have backup drives still going after 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: W. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: 3X failed drives..not so good
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing and using this product over a year now, I had to return the 1st drive due to failure...returned drive got a 2nd replacement drive and the 2nd drive failed in under 90 days. Seagate sent another replacement and now the 3rd drive failed last night 120 days after receiving the replacement ...if i hadn't had a 2nd back drive all my data would be lost. I have digital photo of my family dating back to the mid 90s. Ok I get it things break... but 3 bad drives...someone needs to kick the QA team at Seagate because thats not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gatdula

customer_reviews.title: Good for backups, awful for general use
customer_reviews.text: Seagate is doing everyone a disservice by advertising this as a standard-duty desktop expansion drive. It's not. The drive inside this is a Seagate Archive drive. It's meant for long-term archival of data, and it's designed to spend most of it's time in spin-down idle. Every operation, except for sequential reads, is slow. For backups, this isn't a big deal, but for normal use as an expansion drive it's not good. Unplug this drive from the computer when you're not using it to make sure it spins down. They aren't meant for 24x7 operation - put your backup onto it, then stash it somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: dingus mcreginald

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
customer_reviews.text: Got first drive summer 2016, ran Seagate's Seatools test on it before using it. It failed immediately. Got a second drive (replacement) and ran it with very light use for one year and one month. Never dropped, traveled or banged it. Second drive has now FAILED. Seatools is reporting a fail on the short generic test. Says to return it for warranty. See pic. I have 2 WD external drives which are older and have never failed. With experience of over 100 Drives of various brands in the past 20 years, this Seagate external drive give clear signs of being a really really terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Senora Alitha

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months of use the device stopped working, I believed the power brick was malfunctioning so I order a replacement, nothing, I desperately needed some of my files, open the case and installed the hard drive in my computer and get my files. That means that the hardware disk/usb interface was dead... after 5 months of "Only desktop" use. If I didn't had a desktop computer that would have been a catastrophe.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Marta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to shuck and works great in my Unraid server
customer_reviews.text: Easy to shuck and works great in my Unraid server. If you're looking for a lot of space this is probably one of the best options to get the most "bang for your buck". This is about $100 cheaper than buying an internal 8TB SATA drive...yet that's exactly what's inside. Not much else to say except that I didn't use the USB functionality of this device so I can't comment on that. The USB interface, however, is relatively small and can easily be attached to another SATA drive, so you could use it to interface with other SATA drives over USB if you wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Skidz

customer_reviews.title: One week and the drive is dead as a doornail
customer_reviews.text: Well, I’ve had this drive about one week, and this morning I had a notice the disk had ejected. Thinking I’d just accidentally unplugged the cable, I unplugged power and USB, and it will not mount or spin up. Pretty bummed. Going to return to Amazon for a refund. Buyer beware on this drive. Had high hopes. Great price point for such a big drive, but if it only lasts a week, what’s the point?
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works until you try to change anything
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until I tried to delete my backup to make a new one. After following all the instructions to wipe an old backup using the apps provided by seagate and my product now has 3 partitions that it made on its own. Two of them contain most of the space and are unusable and unchangeable, with the third being the only usable but with only 30gb of storage so in essence useless for backing anything up. The seagate apps don't allow me to do anything and most of the time my seagate doesn't even appear on my pc as a drive. I've spent days trouble shooting and I'm done wasting time with this.
customer_reviews.author: Nidhoggr

customer_reviews.title: Performance penalty with this drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive offers a great price in terms of capacity. The price you pay is in performance. Since the drive uses shingle technology the read and write performance suffers as shown in the images. If performance is not important it is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but.....
customer_reviews.text: I like the looks and the compact size of the drive. I don't like that I just received it yesterday afternoon and out of the box it wont work. If you watch the video I attached you will hear the device make four sounds. I looked it up online and it says that it means red, white and that something is stuck. What really upsets me is that I transferred 1TB of data onto it and I hope that data isn't going to be lost. This could have been a faulty device and another one will be fine but it really sucks having to deal with a faulty device right out of the box. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Random Buyer

customer_reviews.title: This Drive Failed, All HD Can Failed, But Seagate Warranty Service is Plain Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one failed after about 6 months. The warranty service on the Seagate website just does work: looking up warranty with serial number and model number return page with error message. There is no phone number or email listed on the website. They ask you to enter your serial number to call or email. I tried the call option, that failed with error message. So I tried email. I got no response. I can tolerate failed HD. But Seagate warranty service just doesn't work! Completely unacceptable, Seagate!
customer_reviews.author: Max Youngerman

customer_reviews.title: Have accessed the files several times since loading it and the drive worked fine. Went to load some more files on it ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get a 8TB Expansion drive after owning several of the Seagate Expansion 5TB drives. Loaded the 8TB drive with about 7TB's of files and put it away for about a week. Have accessed the files several times since loading it and the drive worked fine. Went to load some more files on it today and was shocked to find it won't work anymore. Have only had this drive since April of this year, a total of 2 1/2 months!! Was going to use this as a master drive to consolidate a bunch of other drives. Big Mistake!!!! Won't trust these 8 TB drives after it failed in this short of time.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: (4TB)never buying or recommending Seagate drives again, drive has ...
customer_reviews.text: (4TB)never buying or recommending Seagate drives again ,drive has been in use for 4 months for transferring edited and rendered YotTube Videos drive stopped working motor in HD is dead, as well as the PCB controller board inside died and the blue led is powered by a piece of foil tape and the hard drive you get is a barracuda Compute ST4000DM005 which is the old generation model the new 4tb internal costs less than this. Hours of edited and rendered video lost and 104$ gone. Leave and go get a Western Digital portable.
customer_reviews.author: jason kline

customer_reviews.title: Take a Spin on Seagate's Roulette Wheel of Quality
customer_reviews.text: 15 months of use. Carefully maintained, no shock, behind a UPS/spike arrestor its entire life, some writes and reads, not excessive. The 'blue light' indicator won't indicate power. Is this what is considered quality? There are some manufacturers that simply don't believe in quality control. Apparently Seagate is such a company. Sure, maybe, the cost is low. But if 50% of their products have a 2 year or more survival rate, and an insufficient quality assessment is part of the process, it's becomes a consumer's gamble and Seagate is the casino. UPDATE: Took a soldering iron to a cold solder joint and beat the house (it's back up).
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Very slow and Noisy Hard Drive!!
customer_reviews.text: It is an 8Tb hard drive, affordable, and from a well-known manufacturer. Therefore, I purchased it. However, as my storage on the drive increased, the drive kept getting increasingly slower in recovering files. In fact, when I had used up approximately 6 TB, file searches took several minutes. Thus making it very inefficient to use. Also, the drive is very noisy at any level of storage. I will not buy from Seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sukhdial

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Drive, shorted out within 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I got the drive hoping for some easy, quick external space, when I got it, it had far less storage than I expected, but I just dealt with that, however within 10 minutes it shorted out, rendering it completely unusable. Tried to check out the warranty on it, as I had the 2 year warranty, but when I tried to go through the seagate site to see the warranty, I was just told "warranty information unavailable". SAVE YOUR MONEY! Just buy the Orico external hard drive enclosure, get an additional internal ssd, and use that!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Jamieson

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these now, most recently to replace a now dead 3TB seagate. I run the 7x24, no sleeping, they get decent read/write activity at all hours. For the price and capacity, these are a good choice for backup, archive, media, etc. It would not surprise me if I eventually bought a third one..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEAD after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: It's freaking out and won't stay connected to my PC. Keeps popping up window whenever it reconnects. Seagate sent back an email saying they'd honor expired 12/mo warranty anyway if I provided information. I provided the information only to receive another email saying they'd need to check status of warranty, as if first email didn't exist. What a waste of time and money, NEVER trusting SEAGATE again. Now I've got 7TB loaded on here an nowhere to put it unless I shell out cash for ANOTHER 8TB backup drive. For shame Seagate, for shame. NEVER TRUST SEAGATE
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tucker Cullum

customer_reviews.title: First Impression Only - Falls Pretty Short of 8 Tb.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box this drive feels sturdy and looks nice. The enclosure does not appear to offer much cooling capacity, however. It's a breeze to hook up with simply a power cord and a (proprietary) USB 3.0 cable. The drive immediately spun up and it's fairly quiet but not nearly silent; not that I expected it to be silent. I was very disappointed to find only 7.27 Tb of free drive space. While I would never expect any drive to have as much space as it's rated, I do expect an 8 Tb drive to be more than 7.5 Tb.
customer_reviews.author: smp

customer_reviews.title: Title may be a little misleading but it's still a great Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: The drive itself is good so far but I feel like the title may be a little misleading. The 4TB may only show as 3.6TB and that's because of the actual byte conversion 4TB is not 4000 GB but around 3700GB. Below is a breakdown I found online: The drive has 4,000,000,000 bytes or 3.72529GB. 1024 bytes = 1kb 1024 kb = 1mb 1024 mb = 1gb 1024 X 1024 X 1024 = GB So 4,000,000,000/1024/1024/1024 = 3.72529GB So by looking at the title, I was expecting my Xbox One to actually detect 4TB and not 3.6 TB, that's a few extra games that I would fit.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzonline

customer_reviews.title: SMR is not for me
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this drive as it is slow almost beyond comprehension. I hoped to use it for Time Machine backups on a Mac, but this requires writing (and overwriting) a lot of data. I have 2TB to back up and while it started out fast, it has only gotten to the 250GB mark after around a day and it's slowed to a snail's pace. At this rate it is unlikely to ever finish. It seemed like a great deal to get 8TB for this price, but it's 8TB I can't use for anything. So maybe not such a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 8TB for $149? Great deal! Baracuda ST8000DM004 INSIDE!!
customer_reviews.text: 8TB for $149? Great deal! Unit works as expected with massive capacity. In fact if you want a 8TB internal drive at this price, just carefully remove the housing and interface and you have a 8tb Baracuda SATA drive ready for format and installation! This unit has a Baracuda ST8000DM004 which sells for $199 WITHOUT the case. 5 minute case removal saved me $50!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: What a hardrive!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen alot of good external hardrives out there before? But nothing like this 8TB hardrive! I can't even begin to fill it up with HD movies! This drive was so easy to install, just plug in play into a 3.0 Usb port in your computer and the way it goes! It is quit an fast to copy lost of files to as well from another drive! I am glad I bought this external hardrive!
customer_reviews.author: Neal Moody

customer_reviews.title: After only 800 hours of use, no longer works
customer_reviews.text: This drive has been used as “cold storage”—connected to perform backups, then disconnected and sitting safely in a padded box. The SMART settings list power-on time at 800 hours (about 1 month of use), but the drive no longer functions. Read operations take hours and write operations cause the drive to disconnect. Seagate’s website claims the warranty is expired. Based on the short lifetime, there is clearly a defect. Regardless of whether the drive or the enclosure is malfunctioning, the unit as a whole should definitely last longer than 1 month of use. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Foster

customer_reviews.title: Work's on the PlayStation 4 or PlayStation 4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have recently just bought a PlayStation Pro with a 1 TB hard drive and with more games coming out soon I know that I won't enough space on my PlayStation 4 Pro so I purchased this 3 TB external hard drive to bump up my PlayStation 4 Pro and with the new update that the PlayStation released out this week I can use an external hard drive and it works perfectly fine plug it in format it and you're set to go
customer_reviews.author: Said

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk!
customer_reviews.text: So...I used this drive for all of maybe 2 months (past the Amazon return period), before it suddenly died. Now I gotta go return it to Seagate (surprisingly, it's been just over a year since I ordered this thing, time just roars on by...and I am legitimately one of the world's worst procrastinators). The worst part about this return is that I have to pay all the associated shipping costs + insurance + delivery confirmation, which will probably run about $25+ I'm guessing. WHY am I paying for return shipping for THEIR defective product? Anyhow...I hope the replacement lives longer than the original, assuming all goes well and I get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: kentuckyfried

customer_reviews.title: Used for Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use with the Xbox One for my boyfriend to have more space for the big games coming up this month. I don't play video games/use the Xbox for anything but Netflix but it was still easy for me to set up. The Xbox will prompt you to select the correct storage type when you set it up and even gives you the warning that is in the comments about it only being compatible with other Ones. It is smaller than I expected but that is purely a cosmetic thing. The light is in the back so it is hardly noticeable in our room when it is dark.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay G

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for PS4 Pro - So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for dedicated expanded storage for my PS4 Pro. So far it's working beautifully; absolutely no increase in loading time versus pulling data from internal system storage, and sometimes seems to even be faster. As a bonus, if you care about the appearance of your home electronics/entertainment setup (which I do), the black casing with blue LED matches the PS4 aesthetic so perfectly when sitting next to it that one almost expects to see a Sony logo on the drive. Of course if it dies or causes a fatal data issue at any point in the reasonable future, I'll edit my review and drop the rating appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Barkode

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. Purchased on November 2016 and no longer working.
customer_reviews.text: It appears that my Seagate Expansion 5TB Desktop External Hard drive has suffered the same fate as many others here. I purchased this external drive back on November 2016. The drive was always on a desk with ample airflow and never moved. All was working fine until a few days ago when my hard drive would no longer mount. The indicator light is also not turning on. Upon closely listening to the internals, a dreading clicking can be heard. This is a significant problem for me as the sole purpose of this drive was to back up my data. Now I risk losing gigabytes worth of data. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: How to use this drive in 2020!
customer_reviews.text: So these drives, because of the Seagate controller, really start to suffer and HARDLY work! We're talking 60kbs copy speed. OUTCH. I just carefully pried off the top of the case and freed this drive from the enclosure. Then stick the 5TB drive in any external bay. Then in Windows format convert to a GTP drive and you have a fresh 5TB drive that will copy at 88MB a second on my system. I have 3 of these I'm freeing from the Seagate Housing Slavery (SLS) to use on a nice external 3-4 bay drive host! Woooooot!!!
customer_reviews.author: Motivation Guy

customer_reviews.title: I hate myself
customer_reviews.text: I hate myself every time I buy another one of these. Like some drug addict who can't afford better drugs and buys the cheap stuff that he knows he'll end up regretting and putting him in the hospital. --> They OVER HEAT which KILLS THE DRIVE. Get a SMART reader tool to report the temperature of the drive. If it's hot, immediately get a fan for it. You "Could" delid the crappy case and put it inside your computer. Too bad that'll destroy the "incredible" warranty. I've had at least 4 of these drives die in the last 6 years. Some were RMA'd. I put my stuff on it. And the RMA drive died in a week. Thanks guys. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Drive.... Doesn't last.. not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This device failed after loading 10 years of photos and video on it. The blue indicator light blinks, but there is no activity on the drive what so ever. Really disappointed in SEAGATE on unleashing this P.o.S. to the public. Of course, it failed within a few weeks after the warranty expired. Brilliant warranty guys.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: 4TB and 8TB are SMR, Seagate lists that nowhere
customer_reviews.text: The 4TB and 8TB versions that I have purchased are SMR. For those that don't know, that means these are useless for workloads that do a lot of random writes. Seagate documents this nowhere. I wish I knew what I was buying, I would have definitely bought something else if Seagate had documented that these were SMR. In short, don't buy this hard drive for anything other than archival
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Matson

customer_reviews.title: DEAD After Two Weeks. Avoid this Hard Drive if you have another option.
customer_reviews.text: I ripped about 200 movies on this drive (BD/DVD) which took me around two weeks. Then I got this message "Corrupted data / inaccessible). I called Seagate data recovery office and they could not scan the drive using their software, but they said that they could recover the data and it will cost between $500.00 to $600.00. I called Amazon Prime and they advised me to try another one. So I'm waiting for a replacement. If you have another option, try to avoid this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sharok

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Works fine with Linux. I've used both the STEB8000100 and STEB5000100 without issue. I was concerned due to another reviewer stating these models didn't work with "all operating systems" (by "all" he meant versions of Windows haha) and/or not formatting to full 8TB. On Fedora (21-25) use (replace ? with your drive letter) gdisk to format and mkfs -V -t ext4 /dev/sd?1 tune2fs -L seagate8tb /dev/sd?1 tune2fs -m 0 /dev/sd?1 The above gives 7.3TB formatted space. Also if you ever see "Ring Error" usually means a bad cable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Hoynowski

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you get lucky, mine contained ST8000DM004 model drives
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 of these to chuck them for a home NAS. They contained drives with the model number ST8000DM004. I guess I lucked out as these drives have generally good ratings (see Backblaze survey). At $140 vs $200 for the standard internal storage packaging this is a steal as of 09/2018. Of course the problem with these external drives is that what's inside them can change from batch to batch.
customer_reviews.author: Till Uro

customer_reviews.title: Great External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I've used multiple Seagate hard drives throughout the years for various jobs and projects. This lets me consolidate the files from each hard drive onto one central one. The storage capacity is exactly like what it says. It holds loads of files and still have tons of room left! The tech support is fantastic. You are never on hold for very long and they always know how to help you quickly and efficiently. It's very portable. However, I would suggest buying a protective case for the device and its cords to help keep it protected. I highly recommend this product to anyone who needs an external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Complete JUNK. DO NOT BUY. DRIVES STOP RESPONDING UNDER HIGH WRITES
customer_reviews.text: These drives are absolute TRASH. Under high write load, the drive just stops responding and locks up my process and system. I bought 4 of these drives and returned 1 for this reason. So then I started having the same problem with 2 that I kept. Frustrated, I took the 2 drives out of the case and placed them directly on a SATA port and guess what, same problem. Under high write loads, the drives just stop responding causing my systems to crash.
customer_reviews.author: TimeLimitXceeded

customer_reviews.title: Too high a percentage rate of failure!
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 hard drives. I have no problems with them. When this 8 T drive was first powered up, it made a loud clicking noise. My computer did not recognize the drive with Window 10. I was curious if I can get my Window 10 to recognize it. When I did, I was backing up files. Half way though, it stopped copying the files. My computer stopped recognizing the hard drive. I am amazed at the high percentage rate of failures for this and other brands of hard drives. Obviously, the digital files are important to all of us. The question is, which hard drive to trust? Amazon was very quick to refund the entire price. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: CTangNYC

customer_reviews.title: This is my SECOND Seagate to FAIL
customer_reviews.text: This was the biggest piece of junk...corrupted files and folders after using for 2 weeks and required use of recovery software which didn't fully recover some media files. This is the second Seagate external hard drive I have had that has failed. After researching Seagate has some of the WORST failure rates compared to other companies. See it for yourself here  Buyer Beware, do not buy this piece of junk unless you want your files ruined. I have a Western Digital external hard drive that has been running like a champ for 7 years now (Unfortunately I need more memory so my search continues!) These last two Seagates have failed at 4 months and 2 weeks respectively.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little hard drive
customer_reviews.text: To start, like many good things in the world today, this is plug and play. Between opening the box and shoving files onto the drive, I spent about two minutes. The drive is very fast to both read and write, with very low latency. The size means I can cram my entire YouTube channel onto it, and still have room for other junk. I use this drive to record webcam footage to, and it keeps up with the live recording wonderfully. The drive is also fairly durable, as it once fell off my tower onto my desk during an earthquake, and sustained no damage. Very good little drive at an excellent, affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: MadXStitcher

customer_reviews.title: I needed space, so I got two of these; 16 TB, yeah!!!
customer_reviews.text: My aging 4-TB drive was getting full, and I had already lost 2-TB of movies and recorded TV when the older drive failed unexpectedly, so I thought I'd get ahead of the game and get some new storage. These drives suited my purpose perfectly, although I would probably select a more robust model if I had to stream a large volume of media to multiple locations; these are not "media-duty" drives, but my wife and I only watch a few recorded shows or movies from a single stream, so "server-duty" drives weren't necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Mbunds

customer_reviews.title: Not good..
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months then crashed. All my memory was wiped and says i have only 60gb of free space when this is a 4/5 TB external drive.. I own 3 Samsung hard drives older than this that works perfectly fine still, I guess I'm switching back
customer_reviews.author: kimson

customer_reviews.title: "No longer recognized"
customer_reviews.text: While this worked well for a while, it stopped being recognized by my laptop. This meant I lost access to some video production projects I had for class, some essays for other classes, and a ton of samples/vsts for music production. It devastated me. I will have to see if there is any chance of getting any data recovered.
customer_reviews.author: Malik Lendell

customer_reviews.title: DOA, would not power on
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with packing and boxing in perfect condition. Unboxed it and the unit looked perfect from the outside, no marks, scratches or damaged. So imagine my surprise when I plugged it in and nothing happened. No drive spin up, no activity light, nothing. Wiggled the power cord, and got a brief light, then nothing. Other things plugged into that surge protector were fine, but I tried other outlets as well. Same result. So, brand new unit was DOA. First time in a long time I've had that happen. Sending it back to Amazon, but for a refund. Not chancing another DOA Seagate unit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this -- it's noisy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the good price. Unfortunately, it's very noisy. I called Seagate and they offered to replace it. I will do that but I am bracing myself for the fact that the replacement unit may be just as noisy. I don't think I would recommend purchasing this unit. If you want to see what others say just type the words "noisy" and "fan" in the Customer Q&A section. I understand the need for a fan, but why can't the fan be thermostat controlled so that it only comes on as needed. Other external drives I've owned are pretty much silent unless they are transferring files.
customer_reviews.author: Becklett

customer_reviews.title: Drive Failed after 18 mos.  Sketchy Warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive in December of 2018 and it died in June of 2020 probably losing everything that was stored on it. You will want to take note that the product page does not even mention warranty details because it varies by product. If you visit the Seagate support page they list the warranty on the 8Tb model as being two years but the serial number and product id on the device itself are not recognized when you enter them into their online warranty tracker (see image above). Since the S/N contains Chinese characters I'm wondering if this wasn't some cheap import version. Buyer beware, it's a cheap product and the warranty support is sketchy at best.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M

customer_reviews.title: Seagate, just terrible as always.
customer_reviews.text: Against my better judgement, I bought this because it was seemingly a good sale price. Well, as always, Seagate sucks big time. This thing worked for a few hours a time, then started cranking and non-stop hard drive activity. Read/write speeds were hilariously low (around 1MB/s, yes you read that right, and that was through USB3) even for Seagate standards. Returning it as we speak and will pay a little more for a WD drive. I will never use Seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Seagate is about quality
customer_reviews.text: Came out of the box hooked up and detected instantly. However Seatools failed this drive for bad sectors and I told seatools to fix all long to replace all bad sectors. It's going to take like 3 days. it should fix it... Its a given that 8 TB of media is going to have some bad sectors... If I find I can not trust this device Il update here and request another in exchange... Seagate is a brand I trust. Update 8-15-2019 Used Seatools bootable and all good. It has need noted that the windows version of seatools may have some incompatibilities that cause errors that do not exist.
customer_reviews.author: TheOldSailor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for music & video!
customer_reviews.text: I direct professional dance companies & have tons of music and video files. This is perfect for storage to make sure my computers stay running well and are not bogged down by excessive files. Super simple to install and navigate. Have had no need to contact tech support. The price is also great for the quality of this storage drive.
customer_reviews.author: Xayne

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, fast and well built!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Very large amount of storage! Works great, quiet, fast and sturdy, well made. Happy with this purchase. PLEASE NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏
customer_reviews.author: Symbols Of LoveTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Died after just over a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last summer so I would be able to take my terabytes of data with me when I moved country. When I was copying data off of it onto a new system last week, I found that almost 2000 sectors had gone bad. I was able to recover the corrupted files through other backups, but one year is far too soon for this to die. When I checked the warranty status, I found that it was out of warranty, so I'm out the $166 I spent on this.
customer_reviews.author: J&N Dieter

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal Write Speeds Even With Proper Settings
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize this is a SMR HDD when I purchased it. After all, the WD 8TB versions at this price point uses a much better PMR HDD. Even after researching online and enabling the proper settings in Windows Device Manager (attached picture for those interested), the write speed is unacceptable for an 8TB drive. It starts at around 100-300MB/s, but quickly drops to the range of 10-50MB/s. Thus to fully transfer 8TB of data, it would take anywhere between 20-100 days. I bought 3 of these and on two the same problem occurs. Returning all 3 if I can and would probably get WD HDDs instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hedgehog Piwi

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Expansion 3TB Desktop External Hard Drive USB 3.0 is very slow
customer_reviews.text: I have a Seagate 2TB hard drive mounted in an external USB 3.0 enclosure and use it for weekly backups of my computers. Since I was low on free space, I got the Seagate Expansion 3TB Desktop External Hard Drive USB 3.0 to move my backup files to. I used a USB 3.0 slot and started my backup. Usually it takes about 2 hours to back up my drives. After 4 1/2 hours, the backup still wasn't complete and I still had only 3/4 of the backup completed. Storage space is great but it's slower than molasses.
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Died on Day one
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a good price for a 6TB drive. I planned to use it for infrequent backups of my NAS. Plugged it in and started copying over data and immediately the drive started making a loud thumping and distinct vibration. about an hour in the copy failed and said it could not detect the drive anymore. The light was blinking on the drive. no information in the manual on what that indicates. I tried reformatting the drive but it crapped out and is no longer responding. Returning for something that isnt cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Your Friendly Neighborhood Trex

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem with a new hard drive before. Bought this Drive in February and by May it was junk. Drive keeps freezing while playing videos or transferring files. Keeps shutting off in the middle of file operations. Rather than waste my time and risk my data I have replaced it with a Western Digital drive. I have bought Western Digital drives before and never had a problem. This was a huge external hard drive ..... if you were willing to waste your time and risk your data.
customer_reviews.author: Laptopbs

customer_reviews.title: Died 9 days after prooduct support expired.  Don't waste your $
customer_reviews.text: 9 days after the expiration of the prooduct support (60 days or so it seems) and the drive is dead. I expected better of course. I have owned other drives similar to this but without problems. Don't waste your $ on this drive, get something else.
customer_reviews.author: deerock

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I shop online extensively and rarely ran into a product that was DOA. This external drive was one of them. It appeared to be well packed and no sign of impact during shipping. When I connect the drive to my computer, my computer never found the drive. The drive was making lots of noise. These are troubling indications. After several attempts with different USB3 ports and cables, I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: PhotographerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with PS4.
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION: This External Hard Drive is 8.01TB NOT 8TB. It may not seem like much but that .01TB renders this external Hard Drive incompatible with the PS4. You can NOT use this hard drive as an external for your PS4 "as is" (leaving room in case there is a work around). But if you aren't intending to use this hard drive for a PS4 or other device that won't accept anything over a STRICT 8.0TB limit then... well it's a hard drive that does hard drive things just like a hard drive should. Though it does run off of it's own power supply so I hope you've got a spare plug-in for a fatback.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: SMART warning after 5 Months
customer_reviews.text: It has only been 5 months since I bought the HDD, 2 months since I've put it in use. Its in a dry environment and never reaches above 40 C. Relocated Sector count (SMART #5) started increasing from 0 about 2 weeks ago and is now at 72. Current pending (#197) is in the hundreds. This is all saying that the drive will fail soon. I will update my review once it does, if I remember. None of my other WD drives have any SMART errors after 3 years, but my sample size with Seagate is 2, and this is the only SMR drive, which could be a cause.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Tran

customer_reviews.title: Crack it open and BOOM!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I buy these drives for my NAS. I crack open the plastic case and BOOM there’s a Barracuda drive inside. It’s cheaper to buy this than a Barracuda by itself. You may always, oh a Barracuda drive isnt good for a NAS... nah, I’ve been running these for 6 or 7 years nonstop without issue. The only time I buy new ones is when I’m upgrading my capacity. These newer cases are built well and I almost sliced my hand off trying to get into it, which is good I guess if your not taking them apart like me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK but limited lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because the drive worked OK as a backup drive for 2 years before it died. CrystalDisk gave me ample warning that it was going so I was able to move data before it went kaput.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Still Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used the 8TB drive nearly every day since I bought it April 2018. It has stored everything I wanted on it flawlessly and I am purchasing a second one today as the first is now full. I 100% recommend this drive to everyone. I can say that if it gives you problems its either something you're doing wrong or a bad drive from Seagate. I use it between work, home, friend's house's (before COVID-19) and I have even used it in the car on a long trips (plugging it into a ac to dc converter).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty certain this thing is not going to last there is something wrong with it already
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty certain this thing is not going to last there is something wrong with it already. I'm using it to make copy of games, and notice on the small file the transfer goes down to literally bytes per second and sometimes even registering as 0 bytes per second. I'm transferring on a USB3 and a SATA III SSD drive plugged directly into the motherboard. Top speeds are well above 100MBs sometimes as high as 150MBs. But it is choking to death when coping many smaller files, I have to wonder if a mechanical issue with SEEK is the problem. I probably would not buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Some USB Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these drives, and both had similar problems with the USB connection. On some ports, they would intermittently drop off and be removed from the drive tree in Windows. This was not a port problem, but a drive problem as I have other Seagate drives that work properly using the same cables on the same ports. Fortunately, I can permanently attach them to ports where they work consistently. If I needed them to be portable, I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Rails2

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing POS
customer_reviews.text: Believe the bad reviews. This thing lasted for about 3 months and then tanked. Failed. Without warning. Couldn't even read the SMART info. Seagate has even designed it to be impossible to put a reputable replacement hard drive back in their cheap plastic case. There are multiple horror stories about Seagate's return and replacement gauntlet - but the fact of the matter is that I don't want another Seagate drive. Ever. Worst purchase I've made for years. Save your money: avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: prfb

customer_reviews.title: Failed, ruined my Life & Business
customer_reviews.text: Failed only after a few months, I take extremely good care of my drives and don't even get near them. I had bought a Rescue Plan but Seagate can't find it and it's not attached to my order : I have now lost a majority of my videos and photos from over the years. Seagate has ruined my business and my life. It was also extremely slow to begin with, cords were also low quality as well as case. I highly recommend you not purchase this item, very unreliable and has caused me financial pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Sugarbaker

customer_reviews.title: Don't let it be your only backup
customer_reviews.text: I have switched between Seagate and Western Digital over the years for my backups. Every hard drive fails at some point. But Seagate drives, including this one, fail at a faster rate. This one was purchased in mid 2017, and was only used for manual backups, generally monthly. It failed by Christmas 2018. Conveniently out of warranty. Not a big fan of the Seagate Dashboard. If you use incremental backups, you will fill even a 5 TB drive very quickly. And you can't use it except with a Seagate drive. Acronis software is agnostic as to drive manufacturer, and allows incremental backups, but then saves space by doing a full backup periodically, and can older backups.
customer_reviews.author: B. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Good YouTube Video Backup Storage
customer_reviews.text: I have almost exactly one year of Planet Mojo YouTube videos on one of these, and am in the process of purchasing another for backing up next year's videos. It takes a few hours to transfer a month's worth of videos, but that's not a big deal for me. I need storage, not a lot of access. When I purchased the drive, I simply plugged it in and it was recognized and started working. I'm hoping for twice the size next year when this one is full.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo

customer_reviews.title: What you need to know is that this drive is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these on Amazon. about a year and a half ago. Now they are dead. Only used them to back up data. Then the drive would not power up. Tested the adapters and they were both fine but the drives are dead. These drives are unreliable, unpredictable and undependable. Buy anything else. Save yourself the extra work you will do when you lose all your data. SEAGATE will simply say "well it's an electronic device." I don't buy that. You should not either.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Clicking only a few weeks in -- the DIED only five months into use
customer_reviews.text: Had this for just a few weeks before it started making clicking/rattling sounds. No bueno when it comes to hard drives. I guess it's good I bought the extended warranty, but they'll just send me one of the same. Sigh. Edit to add: after only five months the drive is officially dead. I only use the drive twice a week and it couldn't even handle that. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Juusan

customer_reviews.title: Died randomly
customer_reviews.text: This died and is no longer usable. Just makes weird sounds and never shows the drive. I had it plugged into a home server, and by the time I noticed it had died, the warranty had expired. Hard drive companies should not have limited warranties, they should stand by their circuitry and replace defective ones. I was able to shuck the hard drive out of the enclosure and it's still readable over SATA, though it has 65,000 bad sectors. I've recovered 28% of it so far using GNU ddrescue.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Mac but no on-off switch
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on my iMacPro. It only took a minute in Disk Utility to reformat it for the Mac OS (ships in PC configuration). I can't say that this is a fast drive—took 3 hours to copy 1.25 TB of files over USB 3—but it is fine for backup. And, yeah, not a looker and really bare bones: cheap plastic case and no on-off switch. I use it as a backup clone and keep it offline most of the time. Since it lacks an on-off switch I pull the power plug after my weekly backup cloning!
customer_reviews.author: P.K. Frary

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Filled up the drive. Data started to get corrupted where files became the infamous "file" type, as well as the frequently random disconnects. More noises started to come from it than normal. Died after 3 months. About to file my RMA Unfortunately, the amazon return period was short, so I'm going to have to go through Seagate's RMA. I've bought many seagate drives, as well as a variety of them. I also have their other Seagate Backup Plus Hub 8TB External Hard Drive (STEL8000100) and it works great and actually performs considerably well, but I wanted to save $10 by buying this one. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimvtum

customer_reviews.title: I've got FOUR of them now.
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what you think -- tons of storage. I've removed one from the case and installed it, but there may be some kind of controller incompatibility because it triggers a disk check on boot up quite often, and never finds an error. In the case, it's about as small as it could possibly be, and it times-out when not in use. I haven't had any issue sharing these drives when attached via USB 3, or directly on SATA (removed). I haven't tried mirroring them or anything though.
customer_reviews.author: Fred.Up

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive back in late November and worked fine at first, however after a few weeks I started having hardware related Windows 10 crashes and then Windows would fail to see this drive while connected and powered on. It had ended up dying on me after a few short weeks. I do have smaller Seagate external harddrives that have worked for years, but I would definitely recommend looking else where for the 8TB version.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.text: Seagate is impressive. I've always been a WD guy, but Seagate has really impressed me over the last couple of years. This is the second multi-TB hard drive I've purchased of this brand and I'm very happy with them. I was running out of space on a 5 TB and did some cleanup as well as purchased this 8TB. The only thing I wish there was, was a direct connection to connect the two drives for a direct, faster transfer, rather than having to do it via PC, taking a couple of days. The product itself is flawless. Must have if you need insane storage like I do
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Space
customer_reviews.text: I got this to download whatever game i want at a moments notice, eliminate storage concerns forever, and simultaneously empty my internal harddrives. MISSION ACCOMPLISHED!! side note i didn't buy it to *be* portable but if needed it would be a simple thing to take it with you.
customer_reviews.author: mrmagness

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my PS4. It has been fantastic so far (about 2 months of use). I have just over 50 games on it and looks like it could easily hold 500. Such a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cory

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe for your data!!!
customer_reviews.text: I only opened one of the two drives I ordered. The second is still in its plastic packaging. I finished transferring all my computers data (close to 6tb) and it only worked for about 2 weeks before crashing and making me loose all my information. I ordered two with the intent to have the second drive as a daily backup of the first one. It didn't give me time to start making the backup before failing. I hate this so much. My pictures and videos from 2003 have all been lost.
customer_reviews.author: SHdz09

customer_reviews.title: 9 1/2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: So, I got mine in mid December, and now it's dead 10 weeks later. So that's great. The thing about getting a 5TB hard drive is that you tend to put 5TB worth of stuff on it - stuff that takes a while to upload, and while to replace when, say, the drive stops working. So even if I get the drive replaced by Seagate, I'm not going to get the time back. This is my second Seagate drive failure in less than 2 years. The price was great, and the reviews are good, and maybe I'm just unlucky, but I'll never buy Seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey McNeil

customer_reviews.title: So happy I got this. Great Ext HD with ton of space and cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: 8TB for 150 bucks. Amazing. Using this with Mac Mini running 10.3.1. Took a little research to figure out how to reformat to use. I kept getting a prompt about "Max disk space" or something like that. Finally realized I needed to click a drop down tab to show more info. Set to Ext Journaled but also need to select a second option after that (I can't recall what it was off hand). Actually works pretty fast for a little USB connection. Not lightening speed but seems efficient. Transferred approx 450GB of data so far. Run very quiet. When transferring data only makes a very quiet sort of crunchy sound.
customer_reviews.author: expert_101

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool. In reality it's 7.5tb - typically marketing BS. It's also a little bit loud when I did the first bulk data transfer, you could really hear it spooling up. Otherwise no complaints. Good value for money. It has a power supply so not sure why Amazon is asking me to rate it's portability.
customer_reviews.author: Señor Pavo

customer_reviews.title: Best External Drive I've Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive (4 Tb model) for nearly 4 years and it has given me absolutely zero problems. I use it as an external storage drive for my Xbox One to store my extra downloaded games. The games install and load very quickly. I have never had any data corruption or disk errors. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect on the PS4 and PS4 Pro!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on the PS4 and PS4 Pro! with the 4.50 firmware update you can finally use external hdd (3.0) just plug it, reformat and your good to go!
customer_reviews.author: DieGuillo

customer_reviews.title: Not 4TB as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed when I plugged in the drive and saw only 3.6TB drive space available even after deleting factory installed files. That is 10% less than advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Barely used for back up before the drive failed
customer_reviews.text: This drive barely had anything on it. I did two backups. Then when I needed it, it would not connect, show up in disc manager. At first it would show up intermittently, then it just stopped. I tried switching out cables, computers - nothing worked. Then it got worse: I contacted Seagate Customer support. They told me to do everything I had already explained. To top it off the directions for seatools that requires a floppy drive or burning a CD! What happened. Am I in 1990. Turns out LaCie is also a Seagate sub brand. Why are all harddrives so unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Paris Granville

customer_reviews.title: Many Bytes, not too many Bucks.
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly so far, but the devil is in the durability. This device is mounted 24/7, and written to daily by FreeFileSync. The case is, well, ugly. But most are at this price point. On the positive side, the case is thinner than the WD MyBook boxes I have been previously buying, liberating a little space in my rack. Assuming it keeps working for a while longer, I will be buying another one -- I am spreading out the purchases to get units from different production runs, a precaution recommended by BackBlaze.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Coder

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 3 months, warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Bought in March 2019 and now in May 2019 it’s dead. Thought maybe the cheap power supply cord was the issue so ordered a replacement. Nope, the drive itself will not power up. Seagate shows it under warranty...but if you read the fine print on that warranty you are responsible for the shipping costs and they simply send you a refurbished unit! The worst part is that drive had 3 months of travel pictures on it that are now lost forever...unless I want to pay extra for a Seagate data recovery plan! Will never buy another Seagate product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1024

customer_reviews.title: I wish it was faster and quieter
customer_reviews.text: What a great price for a terabyte of storage. But I have to say it's not as fast or as quiet as I was hoping. I had a 4 terabyte Seagate external hard drive I was using before this and it did not require a power supply and didn't make a sound and it was very fast. This 8 terabyte drive takes awhile to spin up and when it does I can hear it. It's not a deal-breaker for me but it is noticeable. So if you don't mind waiting for the ever so slightly slower drive and don't mind the noise I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Yakmaniac

customer_reviews.title: BIG A** DRIVE
customer_reviews.text: I MEAN MONSTER TRUCK SIZE! THIS THING CONTAINS 8 TERABYTES OF RAW SPACE, WHICH YOU CAN FILL WITH JUST ABOUT ANYTHING. IN FACT ITS SO BIG I HAVE TO SHOUT. aside form that, it is large. the USB 3 allows for fast transfers, and being able to move it around is helpful. I got this to supplement a 6TB NAS system which was starting to have some issues, and so far it is not having any problems. we currently move this drive from laptop to laptop as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Arterburn

customer_reviews.title: Total JUNK and 1 year warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Drive FAILED right out of the box, brand new sealed item! What kind of a quality control they have?! My friend's 6TB version of the drive failed 3 month after purchase. It should tell you something already. Western Digital offers 3 years warranty, Seagate only 1. Now I know why, because their product is a total junk. Done with their products for good
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: 3-Year warranty so it lasted 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Of the 2 drives purchased 3 years ago, one lasted 37 months. The 2 drives are/were used for offsite backups and were switched each month. Drive made no mechanical noise so failure seems to be with the onboard electronics. Drive appeared normal when connected to computer but mounting the drive would cause the file system to hang. Putting the drive in another enclosure also resulted in the file system hanging.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brockway

customer_reviews.title: Best 8TB HD for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use them as MacOS Time Machine backups, once they fill up, I unplug them, place them in a drawer and buy a new one. Whenever I have had to retrieve archived data, they have never failed me. I've now purchased five of them. You're not going to find an 8TB 7200RPM HD for less money, internal or external. My cat knocked one off the table while it was plugged in and operating - killed it permanently. Otherwise I have never had any problems with these drives. Very happy, very good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: ped xing

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer... Literally. Purchased for my PS4 Pro system w/300+ Games. Connection was simple and easy. System recognized the drive immediately and gave the option to reformat. Reloading of games took 2 days, but did so flawlessly. (You have to manually delete and then download via the library. Slow process, but worth the ability to purchase more without worry of space. Loved this upgrade!! Will buy again.... (for second PS4)
customer_reviews.author: Casey Warner

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR VIDEO EDITING - STORAGE/ARCHIVE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this drive hoping that it would be useful for video editing. The amount of storage and price seemed remarkable vs solid state drives. If you need simple mass storage with no speedy read/write requirement, this device is fine. When editing vide on a PC, the drive frequently lost communication with Premiere. After waiting for the drive to spin up time and time again while working (to regain communication with Premiere), the drive failed to communicate at render time as well. The rendered video came out mostly red, with Premiere's classic source media offline image! The drive simply doesn't communicate quickly and efficiently enough for editing and rendering. INFERIOR, AVOID
customer_reviews.author: MrCold

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed seagate, 5 month life span is unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: purchased august 2017, dying today 12/17/2017. very disappointed seagate, 5 month life span is unacceptable. drive shows health status as caution in SMART and other apps. used lightly as a PLEX media drive for home movies and life videos. i've lost a few trying to desperately copy it back to my trusty WD drives. never again.
customer_reviews.author: Brett M. Vandeursen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 different sizes, 5TB for myself and 3TB for someone else, and they've both worked great. I've had my 5TB for a year and a half now and nothing has gone wrong, where with other hard drives I've had to replace them 6 months. The drive is always in use, either for recording or file transfer reasons. The 3TB doesn't get as much use but hasn't caused that person any issues and they're fairly computer illiterate. Keep in mind this is is not designed to be moved around a lot. If it is dropped, even a few inches at most, it will damage the drive. It should be put in a safe place and left there.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Seagate quality shines in this hard drive; the power supply less so.
customer_reviews.text: Exterior drives are terrific for archivers. I remember my first i gB hard drive very nearly three decades ago; who could want more storage space I wondered. Well, after three decades of computer usage, a single gB got stuufed. This exterior box is a lifesaver. However, the exterior power supply is not even a fraction as reliable as the Seagate drive itself; mine failed after less than a year. Thank goodness I could convert existing power supplies as substitutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd M. Fuke

customer_reviews.title: I had to upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I got an amazing deal on this external hard drive on Amazon Prime Day. I needed a bigger hard drive to put all my games on from my Xbox one. I had a Seageate 5tb hard drive but it was getting close to full and now with this I can store just about anything. It doesn't get as hot as my last hard drive and it seems a lot faster especially when transferring files. Just seems to be way more efficient. All and all I'm perfectly happy I had to make the upgrade and I would do it again if I needed even more space.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Naftzger
